pages.text: Applied Energistics 2 is a storage mod.$(br2)In Cottage Witch, we have $(l)heavily$() modified the recipes and gameplay surrounding AE2 to make it more thematic and accessible for all skill levels.

This section of the FAQ book is meant to be used in conjunction with the $(#8b32a8)quests$() under the $(#cbcc50)storage section$().$(br2)If something doesn't quite make sense, make sure to look in $(l:patchouli:mods/jei)JEI$() and/or the $(#8b32a8)quest book$()!$(br2)AE2 is very similar to Refined Storage. Some blocks have direct equivalents, but there are differences.

pages.title: Storing Items
pages.text: One difference is storing items. In RS, you would want to make a $(thing)Celestial Glyphstone$() (or 64k drive) to store as many items as possible.$(br2)Take a look at some AE2 glyphstones on the right. There is a $(l)limit$() on the number of $(l)unique item types$() that a glyphstone can hold.

pages.title: Storing Items
pages.text: Hovering over this $(thing)Celestial Glyphstone$(), it says there are 0 of $(l)63 types$().$(br2)This means that $(l)63 unique items$() can go into that glyphstone.

pages.title: Storing Items
pages.text: There is another number there - 0 of 65536 Facets. This is the $(l)total number$() of items that can go into this glyphstone.$(br2)This means you can stack a $(l)large amount$() of any of the $(o)63 unique item types$().$(br2)As soon as you try to put a 64th item type in, you won't be able to.

pages.title: Which Glyphstone to Use
pages.text: Crafting the Gems (comparable to crafting glyphs in RS) is more complex due to how their storage works.

We recommend starting with the $(l)Arcane Resonant Glyphstones (4k)$() for storing most of your items while getting the most out of your resources.$(br2)If you find you have a large amount of some items, consider storing them in a $(l)functional storage drawer$() or making the larger glyphstones!

pages.title: Making an AE2 system
pages.text: Picture of a simple AE2 Setup

We couldn't get a multiblock for this setup in, so please take an image in its stead.$(br2)For a simple setup, you will need a $(thing)Glyphic Repository$(), $(thing)Lodestone Core$(), a $(item)$(t:Allows only viewing)Scrying Nexus$() (or) a $(item)$(t:Allows viewing and crafting)Nexus Crafting Aperture$() $(l)on a $(item)$(t:Fluix Covered Cable)cable$(), and $(thing)Glyphstones$()!$(br2)Hover over the $(item)purple$() text for more info

pages.title: External Storage
pages.text: Want to hookup your Functional Storage Drawers?$(br2)The equivalent of the RS $(thing)External Storage$() for AE2 is the $(thing)Nexus Storage Anchor$()!$(br2)Remember that the $(thing)Storage Anchor$() sits on a $(item)$(t:Fluix Covered Cable)cable$() connected to your AE2 system.
This connects to your Functional Storage $(thing)Storage Controller$()!$(br2)Recall that you should increase the priority of your $(thing)Storage Anchor$() to store items in the drawers.

pages.title: Going Wireless
pages.text: Your wireless journey will require a handful of items and blocks.$(br2)To start, add these two blocks onto your existing AE2 system: The $(thing)Resonance Access Point$() and the $(thing)Guardian Ward$(). $(br2)Then you will need to connect your $(item)Resonant Aperture$().

pages.title: Getting Access
pages.text: Connect to your network by $(l)shift clicking$() your $(item)Resonant Aperture$() inside your $(thing)Guardian Ward$().$(br2)Now you will have short range wireless access!
Example of Guardian Ward with linked Resonant Aperture!

Next, let's get the required materials for $(l)cross-dimensional$() access.$(br2)We will need to make a $(thing)Planar Relay$(), which is made using the fairy ring on the right!$(br2)Inside the fairy ring, toss an $(item)Eye of Ender$(), $(item)Rough Lazurite$(), $(item)Tablet of Binding$(), and $(thing)Consecrated Certus Quartz Crystal$()

pages.name: Fairy Ring
pages.text: The center dirt blocks can be any block

With the $(thing)Planar Relay$(), you will make two $(l)linked$() $(thing)Entangled Planar Relays.$()$(br2)In order to do this, you will need to explode a $(thing)Planar Relay$() and $(thing)Ender Dust$() or an Ender Pearl.$(br2)You can obtain $(thing)Ender Dust$() by crushing an ender pearl using a crushing wheel or a millstone.
For a small explosion that causes no block damage use $(thing)Tiny TNT$()!$(br2)Drop both items on the ground next to the Tiny TNT and then light it with a flint and steel.

pages.title: Crossing Dimensions
pages.text: A multiblock structure will need to be connected to your AE2 system.$(br2)After connecting the $(item)Planar Relay Link$() with a cable, right click on the center block and insert one $(thing)Entangled Planar Relay$().$(br2)You'll need the second $(thing)Entangled Planar Relay$() in the next step.

pages.name: Planar Relay Link
pages.text: Requires 8x $(thing)Planar Relay Tether$() and 1x $(thing)Planar Relay Link Chamber$()
Finally, we will need a $(thing)Planar Bridge Card$() and the second $(thing)Entangled Planar Relay$().$(br2)Open your $(thing)Resonant Aperture$() and find the sidebar to the right
$(l)Manually$() insert both items into the sidebar.
Ensure the chunk containing your AE2 system is chunk loaded!$(br2)You can read more about chunk loading $(l:patchouli:mods/ftb#claiming)here$()!
